notes: Classic open-top off-road vehicle with leaf spring suspension, Dana axles, and transfer case. 1972 saw wheelbase stretch and introduction of AMC engines. 1976 body tub and frame modifications. Manual choke carburetors and points-based ignition require vintage vehicle maintenance knowledge. Optional Quadra-Trac full-time 4WD system. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep CJ article, January 2025 revision.

Long-wheelbase variant of CJ-5 with 101-103.5 inch wheelbase (vs. 81-84 inch CJ-5). Total production of 50,172 units (1955-1981), primarily exported to Sweden and South America. Similar mechanical specifications to CJ-5 with same AMC engine options, leaf spring suspension, and Dana axles. Manual choke carburetors and points-based ignition. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep CJ article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 2.5L (151 cu in) GM Iron Duke I4
body_styles: 2-door open-top utility vehicle with optional hardtop
notes: Introduced in 1976 with 93.3-inch wheelbase, longer than CJ-5 allowing for optional automatic transmission and hardtop. Optional Quadra-Trac all-wheel drive system. Available with molded hardtop and steel doors. Renegade and Laredo trim packages offered. Diesel option via Isuzu 2.4L I4. Manual choke carburetors and points-based ignition on most models. Dana axles and leaf spring suspension. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep CJ article, January 2025 revision.

First marketed use of 'Sport Utility Vehicle' term appeared in 1974 Cherokee sales brochure. Initially 2-door only, 4-door added in 1977. Optional Quadra-Trac full-time 4WD system. Dana 44 axles front and rear, Dana 20 transfer case. Optional disc brakes, leaf spring suspension. 401 V8 discontinued end of 1978. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Cherokee (SJ) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 5.7L (350 cu in) Buick Dauntless V8 (230 hp)
notes: 1970 introduced 327 AMC V8 (250 hp), replaced by 360 AMC V8 in 1971. Buick 350 Dauntless V8 used 1968-1971. Quadra-Trac full-time 4WD introduced 1973. Front disc brakes standard from 1974. Strengthened boxed frame rails in 1976. 'Limited' luxury trim introduced 1978 with Quadra-Trac, power disc brakes, leather upholstery. Dana axles and leaf spring suspension. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Wagoneer (SJ) article, January 2025 revision.

engines: 4.2L (258 cu in) AMC I6 (112 hp, 210 lb-ft)
6.6L (401 cu in) AMC V8 (330 hp, 430 lb-ft)
notes: J-10 and J-20 designations introduced in 1974 (indicating payload capacity). Full-time Quadra-Trac 4WD system available (replaced by Selec-Trac in 1983). Larger brakes standard from 1974, reduced turning radius. Dana axles and leaf spring suspension. 401 V8 available 1974-1978. Various bed configurations offered. Data sourced from Wikipedia Jeep Gladiator (SJ) article, January 2025 revision.
